byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Warsaw, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Pres Obama says recent violence involving young black men and police officers has not divided United States to degree that racial conflicts of 1960s did; optimistic remarks are made during press conference following European security summit in Warsaw.
lead_paragraph: “When we start suggesting that somehow there is this enormous polarization and we’re back to the situation in the 1960s — that’s just not true,” President Obama said.

headline.main: Obama on Dallas: No Reprise of ’60s Racial Strife
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Racial Strife Has Not Left Nation as Divided as It Was in 1960s

snippet: “When we start suggesting that somehow there is this enormous polarization and we’re back to the situation in the 1960s — that’s just not true,” President Obama said....
